content:
Among the heartlands of Albion, a mere sixty kilometers north of the capital of Bowerstone, stood the Fort of Heroes, known more formally as Fort Grey, and its surrounding Williamstown. 

Here, the festivities of the Guild's Founding were unfolding in full swing: a carnival of colors and games, costermongers selling candy and fruit, children running around with fireworks. Rumors passed between lips about the speech the Guildmaster was meant to give shortly before ninth bell.

It was here that our story began.
Alecto II and Lupe

Alecto sat and observed from within her "cage" as her dear Lupe carried her along. At first it had been strange to have a single person bear her palanquin, not to mention disoriented when incidents occurred, but now she wouldn't have it any other way.

"Darling? I don't suppose we could stop for some refreshments? Those candied apples look delightful."

"Ah - no, this is perfect. Thank you for having such consideration for me. You're truly the best evil captor I could have wished for." Alecto said, looking intently at Lupe. She could feel the eagerness well up, to see her darling pet climb a tree and fetch her fruit. Such debased mortality... what a delight.
A Carnival Attraction

In the middle of a random street of this joyous festival there sits a rather shiny man on a rather ordinary stool, well... to say he's shined at the moment would be rather an innacurate description.

Why? Well because he's decided to raise spirits at the festival by allowing passers by to paint his body with a variety of colours in whatever pattern they desire!

Has this ended up with him looking rather ridiculous at this current moment? Most certainly. Is it worth it to see those smiling faces as they pass him by?

It's worth more than the world to him.

Giggling happily to herself as she was complimented, the princess could observe a bump moving left and right in the back of this witch's dress. Though however, it seemed like Lupe was stumped by the task of picking the best apple.

Much to the chagrin of the owner of the candied apple stand next over, Lupe would simply decide that she would violently rip the arbour from the ground. The poor man would duck to the floor as she haphazardly turned about and leant down the average conifer's crown of leaves down for Alecto.

She couldn't help it. A giggle slipped out of her throat. What an adorable child! How enthusiastic. She reached out of her palanquin and plucked an apple at random from the tree, trusting her spirit to guide her well. She bit into bit with joy, enjoying the filth of mundanity stinging her tongue. It was an awful sort of delight, almost sickly sweet.

"Thank you, dear. Feel free to put it back," she said, as an earing glowed subtly in the daylight, and the roots of the tree were filled with unseen vigour ready to replant itself with minimal harm done.

"I'm glad you like it! Witches are very known to be apple experts." It seemed she was confusing fairy tale characters and the poisonous nature of their apples. Regardless, she would never be corrected on her misconceptions with the current cro

With Gusto, she would once more narrowly avoiding killing the poor stall owner fearing for his life before slamming the tree back into the ground. 

Then Lupe stared at it, the wag motion in her dress gone as her shoulders slowly hunched. She leant, inconsolable, against it's trunk.

"*I-i should've used magic to get the apples...*" The witch said dejectedly.
"It's alright, pumpkin. You'd hardly want to cheapen your magics by expending them on such minor tasks as feeding me, would you?" said Alecto.

"W-what are you talking about!" She turned around exasperated with a defeated look in her face. "You're my prisoner! It's my upmost duty as your EVIL (she shouted) prisoner! It's my duty to make sure you are so happy you don't wanna leave!"

All too easy. "And you do! Every day, you make me so happy to be your prisoner. But, speaking of dark deeds, look over there." Alecto said, indicating a metal man shining in the sun, surrounded by a gaggle of children painting him. 

"I believe he's one of your colleagues, yes? The obnoxious one that proclaims himself a hero at every turn. Wouldn't it be fun to paint him with your Witchmark?"
"Yes, we'll coat him in the cruelest and most wicked arbor," Alecto said agreeably.
"Okay, do you want to walk or do you *want* to be taken over there in your prison?" She asked, it was vibrantly clear she preferred the latter. Like a puppy showing off her favourite stick.
"Of course I should stay imprisoned, darling. You wouldn't want to lose me in the shuffle, would you?"
Genuine terror flashes over her face at the idea and she vigorously shakes her head left and right. "No! I don't want to lose you, even a little bit!"
"Then don't. It'll be alright. Just keep me close, and I'll stay with you forever."

A girl clad in a green tattered cloak approached the chrome figure with a small paintbrush and wrote something on its back, where he couldn't see nor reach. She took a while to write that properly, but then she giggled to herself and pat the metallic figure on the head.

"Our usual?" she whispered in his ear, mischievously.

She'd flash her gigantic toothy grin, barely retaining her excitement at that innocent promise. 

"Can I hug you? Once, please?" Lupe pleaded with her eyes. "Please?"
"Very well, Lupe," Alecto said, as she opened her arms and repressed a shiver of elation.

"Sure, what's on my back?" He's whispering back out of the corner of his mouth, he's been playing up the statue bit for the last group of kids and he wants to see if any of them notice him actually moving.

Getting people aware of dangerous things in a safe way is part of a heroes duty after all!

Lupe would instantly leaped forward with frenzied fervour, like an elastic band finally released and able to act on it's elastic potential. 

She took advantage of her larger frame to embrace the princess, squeezing her close as close as she could, resting her chin on Alecto's head.
"Poop," she whispered in his ear. She leaned on him, placing her chin on his shoulder and getting some of the paint smudges on it. She didn't much care about that. "You first or I first?"
And Alecto would gladly consent to being embraced, shooting a murderous look at an onlooker who seemed to be annoyed at the pause in traffic.

"Hmm, you first, I've gotta work on copying thicker stuff, and your weapon is pretty thick."

Innuendo? Potentially from most other people, but Chrome fully knows Isa is a hero, so she's not for him like that

The irredeemable evil woman would thoroughly enjoy the most devious hug for a few minutes, the wagging motion beneath her dress. 

Once she was happily satisfied, the witch would lift up the palanquin and start moving over to the statue.

Approaching the exercise in animate creative self expression would be yet another regular Fort Grey sight.

Which of course was, a tall woman in an elaborate yet worn down set of witch clothes. Above her head, a gigantic ornate palanquin clearly out of the ordinary with the local architecture. 

Breathing in, she'd shout at them her regular greeting.

**"FOOLISH MORTAL. IN THE BLACKEST DEPTHS, I DRAW MY STRENGTH, AND I SHALL SMOTHER THE LIGHT OF YOUR HOPE WITH MY DARKNESS!"**

Pausing for a second to take in that greeting Chrome perks up fairly rapidly, abandoning the act of being inanimate to stand up straight, arms out to the side as if for a hug as he calls back at a similar (But lessened because he knows it hurts the ears of people) volume.

"GREAT TO SEE YOU MY WONDERFULLY VILLAINOUS FRIEND! WHAT FOUL DEEDS HAVE YOU DONE TODAY?"

Seeing Lupe arrive, and Chrome stand up straight, Isabella decided to simply take the chance. Unfurling her cloak and unsheathing her mace, she called out.

‚ÄúBeware, evildoer!‚Äù she shouted, pointing her mace at the sky. ‚ÄúBeware the light and chroma of justice!‚Äù

And with that, Isabella picked up Chrome and powerfully launched him at Lupe, like they‚Äôd very often do.

Lupe's eyes would wide in shock at the sight of a 500 pound plus man being thrown at her, quickly glancing up at her payload before rolling her eyes annoyed. Another situation where she could not use her awesome magic to solve the situation.

Instead Chromium's face would impact her foot with a loud boom, cracking and tearing some of the bones and muscles in the witch's leg could be heard.

Though, as fucked as it appeared it seemed to quickly put itself back together quickly, Lupe shaking her foot like it was a common cramp before as her average human regeneration kicked in and fixed any damage.

"Stop throwing him when I am holding the princess! I can't do magic without my hands! What if I drop it!" She sounded upset.
Partaking

Seizan's mind was split along many trains of thought as she, Adam, and Kaido walked around the fairgrounds, largely aimless.

A part of her was considering just what had brought them all to this strangely altered Albion. It was difficult to identify, though, since there wasn't really any forewarning or sign or evidence. One instant, they had been stepping off her ship and into the albionian port, and the next instant, they stepped onto an entirely different port, an unfamiliar ship behind them. In some sense it was a fortunate transposition, since this Other-Albion was seemingly free of Script's rulership, but it still left her with only the contents of her void pocket and Adam's backpack. No boundless riches, no center of power, no expansive criminal empire. Only the lingering knowledge that those things had all been a lie to start with, strings for the Knower of Names to pull her around like a puppet with. Maybe it's better to go without. Hopefully Vance would be alright without their help.

Another part of her considered the local Guild of Heroes. Undefeated and ascendant, headed by a distinctly...*ominous* figure. Working along with them seemed like the only feasible choice, for now at least, and may well be the best option long term, especially given her intent to try and avoid the path the Knower had set forth for her. Working underneath others rankled her, deeply, but hopefully she would be able to prove her value and rise to masterhood soon enough.

A third part of her considered the various snacks available from the various hawkers set up around the fair. She'd been devouring a continuous stream of them from the great pile that Adam was balancing between his arm and chest. Albionian cuisine was unfamiliar to her, but fairfood wasn't, and there some inescapable similarities. Candied fruit and fried dough, excellently made and deliciously sweet and oily. A comfort she hadn't expected to need, but which she found all too necessary.

‚ÄúDropping the princess is what you should do, evildoer!‚Äù Isabella chided with a finger wag, suppressing a giggle with a semi audible snort. ‚ÄúIt was a ploy to free her from your devious grasp!‚Äù

Getting up afterwards with a pep in his step and a massive gleaming smile on his face he resumes hugging his friend! Under the arms of course, can't have her drop an innocent woman-

"Lupe!"

Alecto felt her heart pulse, and her blood rise and she struggled mightily with the urge to wipe this insignificant pretender to divinity from the face of this misbegotten planet, and the rest of the worthless town with her.

She thought of Lupe and how sad her darling would be and her cutely drooping ears and her puppy dog eyes, and managed to wrangle herself back into some sense of sanity.
"Did I ever proclaim any need for rescue, knight?" Alecto said coldly.

Adam, meanwhile, was enjoying the entire festival at once, more or less. His true name shared a considerable portion of the sensorium of everyone in a radius of several miles (or at least, everyone who wasn't shielded, one way or another), and at the moment that included just about everyone participating in the festival. It was an interesting experience, so different from the months crossing barren desert or open ocean that had dominated most of his time on the previous version of Albion. The fact that Seizan was enjoying herself with the food cemented his feeling that this was a positive change.

Isabella‚Äôs arms dropped to her side in the most visible representation of ‚Äòbruh‚Äô ever. She sighed and picked up her cloak from fhe ground. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a performance, ma‚Äôam. We do it all the time when there‚Äôs festivals like this.‚Äù
Alecto recalled the sickening crunch of the impact.

She ignored the knight, dismissing her as little more than a speck of dust.

"Lupe, dear, are you well?"

Lupe was smiling to herself like a dumbass, Alecto defending her imprisonment was quite joyous.

"I am!" She then turned to the metal dome and her expression turned into utter disgust.

"Get off, you're ruining my witch outfit! Get off!" Though she could fend him off, she was still holding the palanquin up.

"But ruining the plans of Evil people is what a Hero does!"

Oh dear God there's that Heroic laugh... way too close admittedly, before he let's go and takes a step back with his hands balled into fists at his hips, classically posed.

"Nah, but It's cool, this paint isn't that bad." It totally is if it can stick to him for long....

In the sewers stands a unusually tall Gnome, donned in the customary blue pointed hat and long, white beard. However, above the beard, a fake red one peeks out, masking his true identity and allowing him to masquerade as a dwarf. 

After he finished fiddling with the pipes and writing down a few observations on the state of the tunnels, the gnome gripped his hat tightly and spun it rapidly. The hat drilled into the earth, creating a whirlwind of soil and roots. With each spin, he burrowed deeper. Then, with a sudden burst of energy, he shot up from the ground, soil cascading off him. He surfaced in the middle of the street, his hat gradually slowing down. There he stood, a ~~gnome ~~ Dwarf  ready to fill his lungs with air that didn't smell like shit and enjoy the fair.

"Guidday thaur shiney, aam aff wark an' hae coin tae spend an' time tae burn afair th' guild masters speech, what's yer act?"
Sensing a premonition of uttermost dread, Alecto said "Lupe... perhaps we should leave? We can brand the metal man later if need be," as she eyeed the dwarf with a look of barely concealed distaste.
She flicked her wrist, and slipped away with Lupe.
"Sorry for that, darling. I just... had a premonition something terrible would happen if we remained for even a moment longer."

The evil witch looks around disorientated, a premonition washing over her that she missed a great act of justice and good in the world that her totally real goddess enacted. 

She takes the time to put the palanquin down, before toppling to her hands and knees utterly devoid of any energy.

In her heart, Lupe knew that her Goddess did something right but again she missed evidence of it.

"Ah! My new ground acquaintance, my 'act' as it were is as a local motive art piece! Pick a spot, pick some colours and paint!"

Leaning in close he whispers.

"Its mostly just some fun for the people who don't have the money to pay for the food or treats, I want them to have some fun, you know?"

content: "ach, weel mit, laddie! a local motife art piece, ye say? 's a braw idea, 'at is! lit me teel ye, a wee splash o' colur can brighten up e'en th' dreariest o' days. aye, it's a grain hin' ye're doin', spreadin' joy amang those fa mightnae hae much else tae smile abit. i'll tak' yer offer, 'en! let's paint somethin' bonnie reit haur in thes corner, a burst o' colur tae match th' fair's spirit! leid th' way, an' let's brin' a bit o' cheer tae thes causey thegither! haud oan techt tae yer brushes, fur we're abit tae mak' thes place shine wi' th' colors o' th' rainbow!"

content:
After a full thirty seconds pause, with absolutely no movement, to the point its unclear if he was actually a statue this whole time he very slowly replies.

"Uh-Huh.... okay!"

Anna's own mind was split as she walked the fairgrounds, largely aimless, but in an entirely different way. As she walked along it was split not by thoughts of what had brought her here but, rather, the coinpurse at her side and the series of games, stalls, and merchandise she could see upon the fairgrounds. Already a multitude of thoughts were popping into her mind about what goods would be valuable on the resale, what vendors would be open to contracts, what games were, almost certainly, rigged, which were just games of luck with bad odds, and which were actually fair and viable to win. The young, red-headed, woman's thoughts were entirely encompassed by that as she let luck and fortune guide her steps through the fairground, aimless but not unguided. Letting the winds of fortune guide her.

Almost right into walking straight into Seizan. Her footwork was deft and she wasn't some absentminded floozy who would, say, walk right into her resulting in her candied apple splattering atop Anna's head. No. She was far more than capable of quickly slipping right around the woman with ease.

"Whoopsie! Sorry about that Ms." she said with a smile as she almost walked right into her. "I wasn't paying as attention as I should have. So many fun stalls and... just..." she gave a happy sigh at the thought of all the business dealings going on, even if a sizable chunk of them weren't the most honest. "Ahhh~"

Ambiently drifting through the festival, and appearing very much in-theme with all the magical floating lights and vibrant colours, the unassuming soul would find herself tailing a trio. People-watching as she'd enjoy the sights and try to soak in the new culture, and seemingly new world, which she now found herself in.

Everything just seemed so new! Maybe it was just her new perspective, without that layer of crystal muddying her ghostly view, everything just seemed that much more vibrant and clear! Julie was a very happy ghost indeed,  having already made a new friend in the form of a chrome man. though he definitely seemed to be quite the eccentric, not that she minded. 

The guild of heroes had already taken her under its wing, which she found quite surprising really, considering she didn't have a body and all, but she wasn't about to look a gift horse in the mouth with all the new connections- all the new potential friends!

Those adventurers had quite the appetite, munching away at various goods. She couldn't help but feel a pang of curiosity, and perhaps a little jealous at their apparent enjoyment of the senses. Taste, touch, smell... They were all beyond her, but at least she could hear and see alright.

Then, an accident would interrupt her thoughts as a cute red-head would bump into one of the girl she'd been following. She couldn't help but let out an ethereal giggle at the sight, revealing herself to them if they hadn't already noticed the little blue light following them around.

Not that she minded.
"Darling? Are you alright?"

Seizan restrains herself from actually aggressing the smaller woman for (nearly) stumbling into her, and instead gives  a (clearly vexed, and distinctly fanged) smile before replying with a noticeable but not overwhelming Mokushugo accent. "Don't worry. I'm sure if you hadn't caught yourself, my friend here would have." She gestures to the red-skinned giant of a man standing beside her, carrying the enormous pile of food she's snacking from. He peeks around the food and gives Anna a more genuinely gregarious smile and waves to her with his free hand. "There certainly are plenty of attractions. As you can see, we've been busy with the food stalls."

She pulled down on the brims of her heat to hide her face, you swear you could hear her repeat an almost insane ramble repeating "she's real" for a moment. Lupe recovered quickly enough however, still a bit downbeat.

"Y-yeah, I'm alright princess. That was a really cool spell!"
"Spell? What spell, dear?"

Lupe brow furrowed in confusion.

"We aren't - where we just were?" She looked down, had they never been there? Was she going insane? Like an actual witch? Awesome. She smiles a bit at the idea she's on her way to being a true EVIL witch.

"Don't worry about it, darling. It's alright. Now come here, and let me pat your hat, please. It seems as if some dust has gotten on it," Alecto lied, suppressing a thrill going up her spine at how easily Lupe took her words.

"Okay!" Lupe believed her, or didn't care, head pats were quite good anyways and it's not like she had to ask for them, win win. Either way she moved up and leant her head down, holding onto her hat so it didn't fall off.
And Alecto, gently as she was able, offered a series of pats atop her head, longing for the day she could rip that wretched hat off and indulge in the fluffy ears she knew lay beneath.

Lupe denied any such ridiculous claim that she was anything but a pure and totally average human vehemently. The occasional feeling of something giddily poking back against Alecto's hand beneath the fabric of her headwear were just powerful witch psychic waves.

At least she seemed to have forgotten about asking if the princess had gotten the ephemeral dust, from the happy giggling.
And Alecto herself couldn't help but smile in turn.
"Now, Lupe, would you like to try out some of those games? And perhaps evily steal all the prizes by winning?"

"Oh my." she said with a bright smile. "Would have been red on red. Red-head upon red man. No matter. I see you've been enjoying yourself, buying lots of stuff. If my sisters were here they'd be more than glad to have you as a customer!" she said before she peered over at the source of an interesting, and etherial, giggle. "Looks like there's yet another here. Is that your follower?"

"Sort of~" Julie would chime in, drifting between the duo at hearing herself be mentioned, her aura glinting mischieviously in-tune with her echo-y voice.

"I'm just floating around and they caught my eye."

"Huh. I was wondering whose perspective that was..." The red man says quietly, mostly to himself.

"I am no stranger to grabbing attention," Seizan strikes a sort of pose, before gulping down the remainder of her current candy apple and retrieving another treat from the pile, "so it doesn't surprise me that I've attracted a gawker. Regardless, what have you been up to?"

Anna gave a broad smile as she picked up a coin purse. "Money! Business! Adventure! Fun!" she exclaimed as she tossed it up and caught it again. "I'm a rookie adventurer girl. Admittedly a newbie, but we all gotta start somewhere. So I was just going out and looking around and enjoying myself. Seeing what games of luck and fortune were around. Looking for good deals and bargains and the like."

Julie would let out q comfortable chuckle at Seizan‚Äôs vanity. She didn‚Äôt doubt her words were wrong though, given her appearance. She definitely had a style.

‚ÄúAh.. An adventurer ay? I‚Äôm quite the explorer myself, though I haven‚Äôt had the opportunity to do much of that ‚Äòrecently‚Äô‚Äù Julie would chirp back, her thoughts drifting as she‚Äôd ponder if she‚Äôd even count as an adventurer anymore after all she‚Äôd been through.

The witch would in turn lean back at that question and turn her gaze onto the princess, her big yellow eyes taking the elf in with a blank expression for a few silent moments.

"Okay," she smiled "i'll get all the the prizes, just tell me which ones you want, Alecto."

"Oh! We--" The red man begins to say, before being fixed by a brief glare from his rotund lady-friend. She then considers what he was about to say, munching through several more snacks in as many seconds, before gesturing for him to continue. "We actually recently joined members of the Guild ourselves. That's why we're here in Williamstown. We're...in a period of transition, I guess, and the Guild seems like a solid direction for us to take things."

"I see! That means we're about equal in rank! At least in the guilds eyes!" exclaimed Anna happily before looking over to Julie. "And as for you, I'm not surprised you haven't had much of a chance of late. You... Do seem sort of etherial after all. A ghost as it were. Which means your luck ran out or something. I don't know."

The portly woman frowns, huffs, and gestures again as she continues to work her way through the pile of festival foods her companions is carrying, and the red man gives another smile, though this one is a bit pained. "Despite our recency, we've actually been given probationary status as apprentices due to our...special circumstances. I don't mean to brag, but it's likely that once the masters have gotten our measures, we'll be raised to heroship pretty much immediately."

Anna had to bite her tongue at the obvious pun that presented itself regarding the womans measures. In so much as the joke would have been humorous it would have done little beyond brew bad blood unless she happened to be good natured about her weight. "Raising to heroship isn't easy ya know. Lots of people join up every year but most peter out before they even break through the first few ranks." she said as she slowly walked around the bigger woman. "And if you think a special circumstance ensures your success, you're just begging to splat against that wall." she gave a small spin to fully encircle the woman. "Course, in terms of prowess, I'm also not exactly exceptional myself yet and, I suspect, you got some super special secret ability hiding up your sleeve. Even if it's to draw an interesting crowd that includes a ghost."

The red man glances back to his friend and raises an eyebrow, and she schools her steadily angering expression and sighs. Then, he replies and offers a hand to shake. "It's probably better if we don't share, at this point, but if you're ever tagging along on a mission with us, maybe you'll get a good look! Anyway, I'm Adam. Nice to meet you!"

"My name is Anna." said Anna with a bright smile. She shook Adam's hand in a friendly manner. "And sure. Everyone's entitled to their own secrets after all. I'm not gonna tell you some stuff till after our first date likewise." she said with a laugh. She wasn't seriously implying they'd ever date. Just using it as a euphemism for how not everyone tells everything right away. "Let me clear this up right away, if you ever met some other girl who looks like me and calls herself Anna, no, I was not her. That was my sister, or mother, or cousin, or something like that. Not me. But judging by how you're acting you haven't."

"Not yet, at least. I'd be *quite* surprised if we had. We've, uh..." Adam looks back to his companion, who waves him off as she continues to scarf down snacks. "Special circumstances, I guess. Still, a whole family of women who all look the same and share a name would hardly be the strangest thing I've encountered. Honestly it kind of reminds me of Nurse Joy and Officer Jenny..." He raises his free up to scratch his chin inquisitively. "Does everyone in your family have pretty much the same job?"

‚ÄúI did die a while ago, but I don‚Äôt let it get me down.‚Äù Julie would hum cheerfully as the conversation would move forwards, a skeptical lilt entering her voice ‚Äú‚Ä¶ And I‚Äôm also part of the guild.. You two sure do seem confident..‚Äù

She wasn‚Äôt entirely sure how the guild worked yet, or the different rank requirements, but she doubted it would be easy, a thought shared by Anna it seemed as she‚Äôd tease the couple.

‚ÄúLamp- Oh, I mean.. Ju..lie..?I think.‚Äù the soul would hum, not entirely sure of her own words. Her name had always been the last thing on her mind after all the time spent waiting for a pair of hands to find her, and she was used to people not asking anyway.

‚ÄúSounds like a nightmare.. Are any of your family  also in the guild? Have you checked the roster? Or is it just you?‚Äù

Anna shook her head. "Nope. For example, my cousin Anna's a shopkeeper who owns a small shop several towns over but has contracts with, like, six local guilds. So the shop doesn't actually matter so long as she matters supplies. My mother, Anna, was a traveling minstril before she met my dad. My sister, Anna, followed in her profession and I've now got three neices because of it. But my other sister, Anna, is a librarian who works at some remote officer college. As for the question of if any of my members are in the guild, of course there are, usually in support/supply roles, but Anna, Anna, and Anna are all honest adventurers as well; though I doubt we'll ever meet them." she said, appearently able to tell the various 'Anna's apart as easily as if they had been named Anna, Beth, Claire, and Danielle.
"Anything, sweetie, as long as it comes from you."
"I see. I suppose you shall!"

"Huh...Well, fair enough. Maybe we will meet some of your family soon, then!" Adam's attention seems to drift after this for a moment, before he refocuses. "Someone is planning to clear out all of the prizes in the festival." He looks to his companion with his eyebrow raised again.

"Hm. I suppose we should make sure to win everything we actually want first, then!" She gives him a considerably warmer smile than the she showed Anna a moment ago.

"Would either of you like to join us, Anna, Julie?"

Listening to Anna describe her strange family of different clones, Julie would remain silent and bewildered at the concept, appearing as confused as a small blue ball of energy could, at least until Adam would move the conversation in a different direction. At least she wouldn't have to remember many names.

Hearing her name, she'd tilt a little in confusion. It didn't sound quite right to her, but she was fairly certain it was the right one. Too much time in the crystal, she supposed.

"I'm up for it~" She'd hum in answer, taking her position over Adam's shoulder, deciding to take the time to examine him up-close with her new-found vision, apparently having forgotten about the prospect of personal space after having none for so long.

People didn't mind having her in their pocket, so what's different now?

"I'm up for it as well. A lot of these games are rigged though, or at least not as fair as they seem. Anything offering a big prize is likely rigged so that the operator can decide when the prize is given if at all. So if you're looking to win anything, it's likely the low-value stuff. It's why I've avoided most of the games. Cause, well, only thing that matters is if the booth operator wants you to win or not."
"Well, if the booth operator cheats, we'll just have to cheat harder!" Adam says with a smile, before following his lady companion off towards the carnival games.

She turns her head towards the palanquin and back towards Alecto;

"In the prison or do you want to walk?" Lupe would ask with the same intonation of a mother asking if their child wanted uppies or not.
"As a kidnapping victim, of course I need to remain safely in my cage," Alecto said, smiling widely.

Anna laughed as she walked along beside the group. "You think you'll beat an expert? No. They'll just kick you from the game." she pointed to a bottle ring toss. "Like there. Those games rely on an almost invisible glass lip around their bottles. You'd have better luck hucking the ring at the operator hard enough to knock them out and grabbing a prize and booking it than you would winning fairly." she then pointed to a basket toss game. "And that one probably has some sort of spring under the basket so that, if you toss a ball in, it will bounce out a lot easier than it should normally."
Adam nods to Anna, but seems undaunted by either warning. "It'd be completely trivial if it didn't have something like that, so it only makes sense I guess."

Looking at her, it seems like Lupe would go through a moment of recollection. She smiled innocently;

"You're very pretty, princess." Before wordlessly picking up the palanquin and going on their ~~date ~~evil prize winning bonanza.

"I hate cheaters.. They were always the worst handlers.." Julie would hum wistfully, sending an annoyed bob Adam's way before moving on to Anna's shoulder, hopping from one side to the other as she'd inspect the woman's face up-close.

Heedless of the ghost's displeasure, Adam approaches the ring toss game, waits for his partner to assess the prizes' value (there aren't any that particularly *useful*, but the highest prize for this booth is a beautiful handcrafted doll enchanted to perform various dances on command, which could at least make for an interesting conversation-starter) purchase a set of five rings for a moderate sum, holding all five rings in his free hand, and tossing them with seeming carelessness at the bottles. Releasing an almost imperceptible pulse through his extended aura, he then guides the rings through their flight, placing each one *perfectly* atop the five furthest bottles (utilizing the borrowed senses of the booth operator to avoid any traps they might have set) and gently adhering each one to its target to prevent them from being shaken loose from their normally-precarious perches.
The Speech

After many carnival eccentricities and diversions, most of the citizens flocked to Williamstown's humble town square. Here, a stage of oak was demarcated with red and white pennants: arrayed and meticulously carved with the Guild Seal emblazoned on most furnishings. Men and women, adventurers, mercenaries, and other would-be heroes or simple celebrants were drinking merrily and deep in song.

As ninth bell dawned, however, yellow sparks conflagrated on the central dais of the stage, with a thunderclap. Cheers arose, as the infamous Guildmaster Hath appeared, a figure out of legend for many: a straight sillhouette clad in an iridescent robe, wielding a magical staff.

"Citizens!" he declared, voice like a church bell, every word projected holographically to Albion's furthermost corners by the array of magitech drones buzzing around him. "I am the Guildmaster of the Hero's Guild, Hath Stur, and I speak to you on this day from our provincial Williamstown. 

It is my highest pleasure to announce that seven centuries and a score years ago down to the exact hour, as the dawn's light rose well over Albion, my friend, Wilhelm the Grey proposed his plan of creating a unified front for those wishing to help our glorious nation, and those beyond: as peacekeepers and protectors of innocence. I feel, in those centuries, we have reached a fulfillment of that dream: the world bending to ideal's design. I am proud of all my comrades, gathered here with me today, and those who even now as we celebrate must attend to arduous tasks: our wishes go to them."
A cheer rose over the square, a loud clamor of tankards and affirmations.
"Now, I would..."

The Guildmaster trailed off, as something black and red appeared in the sky with a sound like a piece of bacon screaming on the frying pan, volume amplified a hundredfold, its clap reaching the earth almost deafeningly.
The Invasion

The Guildmaster trailed off, as something black and red appeared in the sky with a sound like a piece of bacon screaming on the frying pan, volume amplified a hundredfold, its clap reaching the earth almost deafeningly.

Across Albion, portals of infernal fire started to open: crimson and obsidian swirling like eyeballs, to allow through entire flocks of winged devils, massive airborne leviathans held on titanic chains of Stygian steel outfitted with ship-like decks and cannons, and even skyscraper-sized cruisers carried aloft with massive sets of whirling rotorblades that could cleave mountains.

And then, as those same vessels projected their sight downwards, acquiring coordinates, portals started to pepper the earth as well: man-sized openings allowing through entire squadrons of well-coordinated devils, most of them heavily armored and equipped with pikes, halberds, and swords, or strange sorcerous implements: wands of spearing red light or staves that spat hellfire.

The Guildmaster, on the stage, reacted immediately: blasting off into the sky and firing citrine beams as wide as a man's torso to cleave leviathans and damage the massive dreadnoughts.

Across every Guild Seal came the voices of coordinator automata, spirits, and Masters, harmonizing and directing everyone's efforts for a concerted defense, rather than a blind panic.
Thus started Hell's Invasion.

Immediately as the world becomes hellish, recognising he won't be as much help as some other members of the guild Chrome Immediately puts on his serious face, his entire body rippling back to a pristine metallic state, all the funny paint flowing off as he claps his Chromium hands together to make a sound not unlike two warhammers meeting head to head.

**"CIVILIANS TO THE GUILD, GET TO BUNKERS AND SAFE PLACES! YOU SEE ANYBODY INJURED YOU PICK THEM UP AND YOU KEEP GOING UNLESS YOU CAN'T GO YOURSELF!"**

And with that he's going to be guiding the groups of children who'd been using him as an art project around the city to safe places, acting as a big obvious [Hit me!] Sign for the demons so they can be as safe as possible.

An entire team of devils spotted Chrome almost immediately and started advancing in his direction: one, the sorcerer, aimed a staff and fired an experimental ray of hellfire, a cursed heat that carried taint and curses, infecting and aggravating whatever it struck. Two of the others swapped scimitars for crossbows, while two stood in front of them with spears and shields.

content: Pushing the kids to the side and behind him he takes the hellfire to the chest, constantly shifting his body between materials to wash off as much of the taint as he rushes towards them at full speed, ready to spear his entire body through the clearly most dangerous member of this small group.

content: The sorcerer's eyes widen underneath the visor at the sudden charge. He barks a word of infernal, some incantation, and creates a shimmering red-orange barrier. At the same time, the duo of spearmen dextrously weave and wave their weapons, lashing out at Chrome from two different sides.

content: Grabbing one spear around the head he fully lifts its wielder off the ground, letting the second spear hit him in the side as he tries to follow the advice of his great teacher: [If the enemy makes a barrier, their ally will often go through it, so use them as a projectile weapon!]

At the same time, the duo of spearmen dextrously weave and wave their weapons, lashing out at Chrome from two different sides.

content:
A spear sinks into Chrome's side, as hot as a superheated caliper, and breaks through the outermost surface and then several strands of muscle.

As for the soldier lifted, this is indeed what happens: the infernal trooper is sent flying into the sorcerer, who'd been mid-incantation, and both clatter and collapse alongside the surprised crossbowmen.
The soldier left standing stares at Chrome in shock, and then stammers out: "W-What are you?! Some kind of Tinfoil Man?"

Looking him dead in the eyes Chrome almost considers smiling at his Mentor living on beyond his years before glancing around at the chaos of the attacked city before shaking his head.

"No, I'm not good enough to be that yet... I'm just a Chromium Foil Man."

And slamming his elbow down on the wood of the spear in his side to break it off he tilts his head back before slamming it into this soldiers face like an Anvil directly to the skull in a headbutt before rushing back to direct the children to true safety.
The soldier lets out a 'gah' as he falls down to the earth, amidst his devilish comrades.

Adam and Seizan had just found their seats and gotten ready for the Guildmaster's speech when Hell literally broke loose. The two share a glance, before Seizan vacuums up the remaining (considerably diminished but still substantial) pile of snacks, gulps them down along with every magical potion, elixir, and pill from her void pocket, then *launches* into the sky with Adam's help. Once she's safely clear of town below, she shouts "**Okina Kuroi Hara!**" with supernatural volume. In the next instant, her body expands in a eerily demonich flash of red and black, before blotting out the sky (or at least what sky isn't already blotted out by the hellish aerial legions) with the mountainous form of an Elder Dragon.

Another instant later, Adam himself dons **Death's Shroud**, flaring his True-Battle Name-Aura to its fullest extent, his flesh fading into same ever-shifting shadowstuff which constitutes his death-hound Kaido's form, leaving only a bloody, skeletal likeness beneath the shroud. Drawing his Phoenix Talon in hand and his Steelwasp Pistol in the other, while Kaido's shadows shift into something between a bear, wolf, and tiger. Then the two deathly beings begins to scythe through the grounded legions, taking a **Harvest of Heads** to search for the location and face of the leader of this invasion.

A single devil met Adam's form like a master's blade meeting a mere adept's, both clashing in an array of sparks and attacks, repelling each other with sheer force and then clashing once more on inhumanly fast instinct like magnetized orbs drawn to each other. Once more crossing armaments, the devil, a nearly ten-foot-tall titan clad in black accouterments and soulsteel armor, seemed to huff beneath its helmet.

"Interesting mortal," it commented, ostensibly fluent in Albionian, "but a mortal in the end."

In a flash of darkness, seven more arms appeared out of nowhere, like an Asuraic halo of arms, each one bearing an exact copy of its original blade: scything with a maddened flurry of attacks and blows.

content: Adam does not deign to respond in words. Instead, he settles the aperture of **Student of Death** on this proximal foe, and drinks deep of the information which flows therefrom, responding to the flurry of blows with supernatural foresight, projecting subtle pulses of aura just powerful enough to turn aside any strike which would land true, waiting for his power to provide him the insight needed to begin slipping attacks through the devil's wall of blades.

The devil chuckled as Adam's defensive skill increased, disengaging with most of its arms, standing a hair's breadth out of effective melee range with the bulk of its mass.

It made a set of signs with half of its blades, flashing through them in a storm of motions, and suddenly Adam felt a *snap* as the influence of Student of Death was cut off.

"Fool," said the being, its voice strangely distorted, and then dashed with even faster speed, a single arm devoted to intercepting attacks, and the remaining seven constantly striking out with superhuman alacrity.

In a secluded and ornate tearoom somewhere within the city of Williamstown the heiress to the March of Ny√≠rb√°tor took her time to finish her tea, delicate lips retreating from the cusp of an ornate porcelain cup gilded with silver in the shapes of roiling flames. Placing the cup calmly on top of it's plate she'd let out a sigh and sink just a centimetre into her armchair. 

This was an unsatisfying turn of events. Not only would she not see what her donation to the prize pool do, she was now forced to work to protect her interests. A festival organized by the Guild was a very profitable day, and now all those profits would probably be dust in the wind.

Not content for her business to be interrupted by the mere forces of Hell, Elisheva stood up and turned to her butler. 

"We'll have to cut the show short, Heinrich, just clean up." Her servant, covered in viscera and blood in equal parts nodded solemnly. The entertainment was already dead 5 minutes into the dissection anyways. 


She had others things to study anyhow.

Ascending back up to the outside world, she would use her thermal sight to notice that devil brains even though materialised, were not that different from other mammalian brains. So while making her way up she would do the easy job of increasing the temperature of the amygdala in the brains of the invaders by a degree or two, to induce great panic, anxiety and anger. 

In the mean while, she would be looking for someone with a prefrontal cortex that was most active, so she could find out why was this happening. She could only assume the fleshbag that was doing the most critical thinking was at least able to hold a somewhat valuable conversation at least.

"What is mine," Adam speaks out, his voice unfamiliar to his own ears, a rasping whisper that could nonetheless be heard as clearly as thunder over the cacophony of battle, "cannot be taken from me." His Aura flares again as **Ownership-Asserting Grasp** reclaims the severed True Name spell. A great leap, fluttering and twisting under the power of **Ballistics Adjustment**, takes him into the air and away, the scent of ozone wafting from his electrified bones as he utilizes **Aura Dash** and **The Body Electric** to briefly achieve even greater speed, only to be immediately followed by thunderous aural blasts from his pistol and fiery blade-winds from his billhook.

Almost immediately, she'd note the ongoing fight between the as-yet nameless devil and Adam, its mind and central nervous system a truly alien thing, a craft of some wicked parallel evolution: resembling more the insane saltatory extrapolation of a sapient centipede than a mammalian or primate system. 

Its brain centers were almost unrecognizable, engaged on a number of strategic and tactical levels, and its nerves burned with snaps of focused effort and sheer instinct harmonized beyond what should've been physically achievable. It was clear the being was holding most of its true strength in reserve.

content:
Stoic, the devil's arms moved out in defensive arcs, intercepting attacks effortlessly while its body stood unmoving and uncaring, like a person concealed by a house's safety during a storm.

Once Adam's bombardment abated or created an opening, the quarry - the First and Foremost, some of his outermost nomen-derived senses whispered - underwent an eyeblink-rapid self-transformation, its spine lengthening like some horrid entozoon, peppered with arms, and like a tornado, those dozens of swords extended on segmented arms reaching out like serpents, intent on destructive murder.

referenced_message.content: "What is mine," Adam speaks out, his voice unfamiliar to his own ears, a rasping whisper that could nonetheless be heard as clearly as thunder over the cacophony of battle, "cannot be taken from me." His Aura flares again as **Ownership-Asserting Grasp** reclaims the severed True Name spell. A great leap, fluttering and twisting under the power of **Ballistics Adjustment**, takes him into the air and away, the scent of ozone wafting from his electrified bones as he utilizes **Aura Dash** and **The Body Electric** to briefly achieve even greater speed, only to be immediately followed by thunderous aural blasts from his pistol and fiery blade-winds from his billhook.

content:
Managing to make her way up to the battlefield proper, the Hero of the guild would face this monstrosity with total apathy, a cold blank expression that some could receive as extreme focus. 

"Fiend." She beckoned heartlessly "What is the purpose of this inane violence?". Elisheva sounded like she was almost more upset about property damage, then the mounting casualties. Though, she must be fighting against the strong emotions that this violence brought forth valiantly.

Adam could feel his body get fresher, as if a computer that was being optimally cooled to the most efficient 99th percentile of a degree at all times. Quicker thinking, quicker reflexes, etc. This excess heat radiated off of him with motes of steam

The First and Foremost instead could feel different variant degrees of colder and warmer, not so much as an attack but simply an experiment. His body a new toy to interact out with and play.

A strong move, though one that Adam is surprisingly well-prepared for. His True-Battle Name-Aura flares again as **Chaotic Distortion Field**, **Rangeless**, **Present Souls**,  and **Name Amplification** layer atop one another to surround him in his own sort of ontological maelstrom, each contortion of reality perfectly countering a single sword-blow, allowing Adam to pass through the First and Foremost's storm of blade as easily he could walk through a gentle rain. Then, having slipped inside his guard, Adam begins to charge his aura for an **Energy-Concentrating Blow**.

content: It seemed the devil's passive primacy repelled distant influence, casually attenuating the thermal impositions of Elisheva's magic, effectiveness curbed to much less than a tenth of what it should've been.

content:
"Perish for hubris."

The First and Foremost's entire body snapped into focus, distant bodyparts carried forth to a single focal point hovering right in front of Adam. And there, holding only two swords in two arms, it unleashed a gradient: an aspect of its own Aura, exhaled outwards with twin sword-thrusts like a stone-crumbling kinetic wave, the force of a hundred trucks compressed for each square meter of its surface.

content:
Off to the side, on a roof top, a booming voice resounds. **"alrecht, listen tae me ye chib eared piece ay jobby. if ye gang onie further wi' yer piss stained pubic hair ye caa a wig, aam gonna wreck yer jobby sae stoaner ye willnae e'en be able tae donner wi' yer limp bobby! aam gonna shove mah fit sae far up yer shaven perfect wee crease 'at yer breath is gonna reek loch sheen polish, 'en aam gonna tak' 'at wee red anal beid oan yer belt, an' push it in yer coopon! aam gonna flagellate ye wi' mah feckin' beard! aam gonna build ye a pair ay runic mechanical balls, an' use surgical precision tae sew them tae yer groin whaur yer manhuid ooght tae be jist sae 'at Ah can kick them wi' mah iron feckin' feit, ye twat!**"

Following that, Gnomio Naddagnome fires two electric bolts from his arbalest at the Demon, showing his ~~gnomish~~ Dwarven fury.
He doesn't have enough hands but as he guides the children to safety he tries to cover their ears(Unsuccessfully) to shield them from the delightful gnomes swear filled speech

Both of the electric bolts struck the General of Hell's side and didn't even penetrate the organic shroud of his reinforced and insulated skin. He didn't seem to notice them any more than he might've noticed a stiff wind.

content:
The booth operater had a dead-eyed glaze upon his face. The sort that comes from working with customers for years with no enthusiasm. Quietly he walked over to the bottles and looked at the rings upon them. "Didn't go down all the way. No prize." he said in a dead, flat, tone. Of course he knew exactly why. It would be suspicious if NO prizes got handed out, but the rings that were actually wide enough... those were safely behind the counter for now.

"Mmmm... See? Told ya." said Anna before sighing and stepping up. She paid for her own set of rings but then aimed to toss them at the low-prize ones, where barely anything of value could be won, and tossed them. Landing all five was easy for her and, a moment later, a small wooden figurine was slid over to her. It likely hadn't cost the booth more than a few coppers and, even with the prize, he'd made money on the toss, but Anna had still won.

"I hate dishonest merchants like this." she grumbled to herself.
(The children seem not to notice, even putting aside the fact that Chrome was by now probably a number of streets away, slowly approaching a bunker.)

referenced_message.content: He doesn't have enough hands but as he guides the children to safety he tries to cover their ears(Unsuccessfully) to shield them from the delightful gnomes swear filled speech

content: Passing the focus of the **Energy-Concentrating Blow** to Kaido through **Master-Hound Bond**, Adam instead once again channels **The Body Electric** to enhance the speed of his reaction, and emits an **Aural Voiding** just in time to ablate the First and Foremost's aura blast.

The First and Foremost, seemingly annoyed the attack didn't seem to have worked, reacted with only a mild defensive fervor to the renewed attack, dashing midair to the side. 

"Annoying. You aren't naturally trained," it said, with that same distorted voice. "More trouble than you're worth. If you run now, I'll spare your life."

content: "Hm..." Adam observed the rings as closely as he could from the booth operator's eyes, before purchasing another set of five and performing the same trick, *except* this time, as the rings descend on the bottles, the force of their descent is sharpened, allowing them *carve* their way down to the same height on the bottles as Anna's tosses.

Elisheva raised a puzzled eyebrow at the passive defences of the devil, her face showing emotion for the first time. 

This thing was ugly, truly a sore to the eyes in the ways not even a mother could like. But it was interesting in the way a circus freak might be, for a second that realisation brought her fond memories of a now escaped prisoner and the one and a half decade enjoyment he brought her.

So instead of attacking him directly, she'd start current of hot air flowing upward towards the sky right above the general, steadily and increasingly rapidly getting hotter and wider.
The First and Foremost seemed to, at least for now, ignore the effect.

content: "What is the purpose of the attack, infernal?" The woman asked again, continuing her thermo-manipulation.
"I pray it's not for the joy of it." After all, there were so many more fun things to do that weren't mindless violence. Like well intended, thought about violence.
The devil released a chuckle. "Willing to bargain with us, mortal? If you can deliver me our targets, I'll be happy to call this attack off."

referenced_message.content: "What is the purpose of the attack, infernal?" The woman asked again, continuing her thermo-manipulation.

content:
*What an insufferable, soot coloured, mutated stick bug that decided to stop trying to pretend it was a branch and instead decided to try and pretend to be terrifying.* She thought.

"What hapless victims are your quarries, abomination?"

"Amongst you hide the scions of the Zeiraam Empire," it said. "I am to capture them dead or alive, with little relevance. I've the means to identify their souls regardless of disguise or lies."

It produced, from a pocket dimension, a small runic slate of dark obsidian which it threw down onto the cobblestone road and then pushed in Elisheva's direction with a telekinetic shove.

referenced_message.content:
*What an insufferable, soot coloured, mutated stick bug that decided to stop trying to pretend it was a branch and instead decided to try and pretend to be terrifying.* She thought.

"What hapless victims are your quarries, abomination?"

content: "If I am delivered those individuals, I shall have no reason to stay and will depart immediately - perhaps even recompense you, if you so desire." It chuckled once again.
"For what purpose?" She inquired just as calmly, catching the magical item with the dalliance of a thermally altered gust of air.
"Heltkaiser's direct orders," it answered with unflappable nonchalance. "I assume for conversion, murder, enslavement, or most likely: as bargaining chips in the celestial war."

In reply, Adam lowers the hand holding his pistol to his golden belt, touches one of its gem-caged stars, and whispers, "Girtab."

Patch of night sky emerges from beneath Adam's feet, seeping out from the cracks in the cobblestones which the First and Foremost's previous attack had wrent open, forming into a enormous scorpion which  joins the fray alongside Adam, alternatively attempting to grapple with its pincers to allow Kaido to land the still-charging Energy-Concentrating Blow, or stabbing with its stinger when the First and Foremost seems occupied dodging Adam's aura blasts and sword-winds.

referenced_message.content:
The First and Foremost, seemingly annoyed the attack didn't seem to have worked, reacted with only a mild defensive fervor to the renewed attack, dashing midair to the side. 

"Annoying. You aren't naturally trained," it said, with that same distorted voice. "More trouble than you're worth. If you run now, I'll spare your life."

content:
"Winner!" Julie would chime, oblivious to the shenanigans and superhuman feat. 

"I think you should go for the fluffiest one~"

As Adam once more engaged, the First and Foremost sighed and said, "Enough of this, child."

He ceased all motion and absorbed Adam's blasts and attacks stoically, each sinking into his own body and seemingly doing no more than slight pushes from a ten-year-old. Once the futility of the maneuvers sunk in, the General raised his own sword.

He delivered a swing that released an aerial cut. It swept through the scorpion in an instant from Adam's perspective, crushing carapace like a precious vase dashed against the floor, night disepelled by dawn of excellence. The General raised his second arm, as if threatening to repeat the feat: as if he were claiming it was only a warning shot. "I tire of your dogged determination. It-"

Then a vast shadow fell over him, and the General immediately landed, sending out invisible magic into the earth in order to reinforce it and use it as an effective platform.

An incandescent, headache-bright beam of yellowish-citrine slammed into the spot he stood on, as wide as a house was tall, obliterating the edges of the street with black-red embers and char staining the nearby earth. It made a sound like a hundred engines ahum with eldritch power. It filled the air with a smell of burnt stone and metal.

Once it terminated, the entity standing there was emanating a dark smoke from its carapace armor, having grown extra layers for added protection: parts of it were cracked, like precious ceramic marred, and the helmet now revealed a set of three, mildly annoyed red eyes. 

"*Hastur,*" said the General with audible malice. As if accepting the Guildmaster's challenge, he brandished eight swords once more and leaped with an almost deafening thunderclap to join the fight overhead.

referenced_message.content:
In reply, Adam lowers the hand holding his pistol to his golden belt, touches one of its gem-caged stars, and whispers, "Girtab."

Patch of night sky emerges from beneath Adam's feet, seeping out from the cracks in the cobblestones which the First and Foremost's previous attack had wrent open, forming into a enormous scorpion which  joins the fray alongside Adam, alternatively attempting to grapple with its pincers to allow Kaido to land the still-charging Energy-Concentrating Blow, or stabbing with its stinger when the First and Foremost seems occupied dodging Adam's aura blasts and sword-winds.

content:
"You cheated. No prize." said the attendant. If he knew about the magic or not was unclear. He didn't NEED to know. The rings that were actually capable of winning were still safely behind the counter. As he looked over to the bottles and saw the carved shape he realized what had happened. "Use of magic in the games is banned. Don't know how you got it to break the bottles like that, but it doesn't matter." he picked the broken bottles up and tossed them aside. "You cheated. No prize and no replays."

Anna took a deep breath. "Hoookay. Look Mr. Let me see if I can make this clear. They're mages. They can probably turn your ass into a frog. You are the booth worker for someone who, let's be honest, underpays you and probably doesn't even remember your name. They came up and played the game, a rigged game mind you, and used magic to win. Now you want to get the magic people mad at you, call them cheaters, and kick them out... on the behalf of some carnie guy who probably yells at you for taking one too many bathroom breaks. That's where your loyalties lie. That you'd be willing to face down a mad mage in favor for."

He looked at them for a moment. "Just take the doll." he said in a flat tone of voice. "And... Nah. Screw that. I'm not gonna stick up for the guy."

Adam quickly gestures to another gem, avoiding the one which grew dim after the dispersal of Girtab, and whispers, "Shimmach," before rising into the air on the back of an enormous swallow made of the same benighted skystuff, Kaido taking on form with elements of giant bat, roc, and wyvern following his ascent. However, he is rather glad to have the Guildmaster's help, since that fight was definitely getting out of hand and it would have been unbecoming for a bodyguard to call on his client's aid. So, he'll hang back and mostly try to help the Guildmaster by harassing the First and Foremost with potshots rather than trying to trade blows directly.

Meanwhile, Seizan herself as been occupied stuffing herself with the aerial forces of Hell, swallowing leviathans and squadrons of winged devils as gleefully as she'd swallowed carnival treats earlier, her black scales glowing with baleful crimson traceries as her magical tattoos, crafted by (a parallel version of) Hell's own hands, metabolize the Taint within, fueling her continued growth.

content:
Seeing the festival's speech turn into a battleground, Julie would take it upon herself as a hero to start contributing to the grand combat by possessing the simple wooden chair she'd been floating above, pushing herself inside it before blasting illumination from every crack and crevice.

It's legs would creak as she'd spring her new body towards the general in an effort to chair-slam him, as bright as a sun in more of an effort to disorientate.

Who knows, maybe she'd get lucky and hit his head to knock him out, or distract him enough for one of those heavy hitters to land a blow.

Adam, who was absolutely getting worked up to launch into an argument about whether Battle Aura counts as magic, deflates a little as the operator acquiesces under Anna's...significantly more reasonable argument. "Thanks. And if your boss gives you any trouble about it, you can find me with the guild. My name's Adam Forester."

With that, he'll take the dancing doll and hand it over to Seizan, who puts it through its paces a few times, having it perform a handful of different dances, before...stuffing it in her mouth? Where it promptly disappears, without so much as a bulge in cheeks.
"Onward to the next game!" She declares, distinctly happy with her first prize.

Impressed by Anna's quick, successful argument, she'd feel it right to reward the rookie adventurer by lightly landing on her head, repeating a couple of times in the closest form to a head-pat as she could muster, before moving next to Seizan and watching the doll.

Julie's content watching of the dances would change to speechlessness as the woman would eat the fancy doll, apparently very grateful now that they *hadn't* taken the fluffiest one as it would disappear.

"Wh- Bu- Th-that was well made! Why would you.. Ugh!" the spirit would stammer, cycling through emotions before settling on annoyed disgust, her blue aura turning white as she'd bristle, shakily distancing away from Seizan, unhappy.

Seizan gives the ghost an equally annoyed glare, before briefly spitting the doll back up from her void pocket (whole and unharmed, not even damp), then swallowing it again. "It's just an extradimensional storage space," she declares with some contempt.

"O-oh.. Well.. mm.." Julie would hum, confused as she'd spit it up again, making some soft ghostly whooshing sounds as she'd grumble away her guilt, drifting back to Anna as she'd use her to hide from the woman's annoyed glares.

_No time for feelings. Fight._

That was Isabella's unique thought at the utter degradation of the situation. Her body went into overdrive, muscles flushed with blood and heavenly might, and the entire battlefield's temperature rose as her aura flared with righteous fury. _Do as my father would. Fight._

Two spiderweb cracks formed in the place where she used to be, and Isabella's mace - as well as her entire body - struck into a group of demons, knocking back most of them and utterly gibbing the one she'd made direct contact with. 

"Come at me, you laggards!" she shouted, her hair flowing and shifting under her own power.
Alecto barely managed to hold back a sneer of frustration as these insipid creatures interrupting her time spent with her darling. That said... a daring escape on piggyback would be quite fun!
The Lunarian descended from her palanquin, and swiftly kipped up into upon Lupe's back, wrapping arms around the witch's neck and legs around her waist.
"Ready to go, dear," she whispered into Lupe's ear, as she began invoking her regalia.

[LUPE Equipped ALECTO II in her backpack slot]

> **ALECTO II** (Casual)
> *A Rank Backpack.*
> 
> *The Abattoir Blade has deigned to use you as her mount while she holidays in this world. See to it that you do not disappoint her.*
> 
> **In the Name of the Moon** [Passive] (B)
> 
> Raise all physical parameters by three Ranks, raise Battle Continuation by a single Rank, raise Disengage by a single Rank, raise Instinct by a single Rank.
> 
> *The least blessings of the moon princess.*
> 
> **Terrestrial Invocation Call: Arise Again**  [Active] (B)
> 
> Upon suffering wounds too grievous to continue battle, the bearer will be resurrected to full strength, and find the benefits of Alecto's passive doubled in all aspects, and they temporarily gain a single, unique power suited to their themes as seen through the lens of the Blood Moon. Upon the end of battle, the bearer will be knocked into an exhausted state and need time to recuperate.
> 
> *"How rude of them to try and break my toy!"*
> 
> ~~**Empyrean Invocation Call: Carcharoth**~~ [Active] (EX)
> 
> *"Don't worry about it. It won't be necessary."*

Anna had been minding her own business at first. Sure, she had met some people beforehand, but this was a speech. Those, while important, were usually long and boring. Even the fun ones tended to be at least long. That all changed when Hell invaded. Anna heard the call. 'Civilians to the guild! Get to the bunkers and safe places!' In so much as he combat prowess allowed, she was still functionally a civilian in the context of a hell-sized invasion! So she did the only thing she could, run. Run. Run and...

"You!" she spotted a civilian whom had been hurt. Instantly she stopped and rushed to his side. Her hands were aglow with magic as she quickly knelt down beside him and placed her hands upon him. Healing magic flowed over him to close the wounds and restore him. "On your feet! Get going! To the Guild hall!" she shouted out before spotting a second person whom had been wounded. Without even a second thought she rushed over to the other wounded person and started to heal and restore them. "I'll bill you later. It doesn't matter now. Get to the guild hall!" she commanded as she healed before turning towards the whirling air vessels and raising her hand up. A bolt of flame formed within and shot up and out towards them. She doubted it even remotely had the range to hit them, much less the power to hit, but... she had to do SOMETHING!

She then resumed trying to scramble towards the guild hall, all the while stopping to heal those whom had been hurt along the way.

The totally human witch would feel an immense font of strength wash over her as she heard her prisoner's words of encouragement. So this was the powerful of evil, it really made her heart faster to the point where it would be noticeable to the princess.

With the new found power of Licentiousness, Ominous and Vicious Evil the witch would immediately hop in one jump to the nearest rooftop, before using her ~~claw ~~nails to make two cuts on each of her palms, before shutting both of her fists tightly.
@birdsie (no rush, you just woke up from your nap)

An entire squadron of devils rose above the rooftop-level on batlike wings, each aiming a crossbow in an ambush attack. At the order of the sorcerer, they fired a swarm of bolts, accompanied by crimson lightning.

The chair provided an ample distraction for almost a full second as the Guildmaster returned spells and attacks with the General. After slamming into the demon lord's bulk, he swatted it aside with contemptuous ease, shattering wood into splinters: however, the distraction allowed the Guildmaster to fire a ray of citrine energy into his chest, slamming him into a wall and crumbling it with the force.

content: "If you insist," said a demon in a suit of regalia with an amused chuckle, armor more gold and silver than sovereign battle-metal. It stepped out from the ranks of its fellows and unchained a flail with a wicked barb on each side, swinging it with casual skill as it approached. Once it was within three reaches of the arm, the devil swung the flail and the chain snapped out, becoming longer: a ball as heavy as a car directed at Isabella's stomach with deadly, organ-crushing speed.

content:
As a result of Anna's efforts, several men were saved: one, stuck beneath a burning log, was aided in removing it and standing; elsewhere, she aided a family in escaping a house surrounded by tainted fire.

Naturally, heroic efforts are noticed, as a squad of three hunter devils with several hellwasps on leashes of chained Stygian steel picked up her trail, attacking from ambush.

content:
The First and Foremost seemed to care only fractionally about Adam's attacks: most of them served as distractions at most, whenever they were aimed well, as the flare of his Battle Aura abraded the damage.

Far above, a dreadnought broke off in pursuit of Seizan, a massive gun rotating to fire out a harpoon with a barbed, wicked end, aimed at her stomach. A squadron of sorcerers whispered spells of weakening, slowness, and infirmity to make her slow and the harpoon's aim true.

referenced_message.content:
Adam quickly gestures to another gem, avoiding the one which grew dim after the dispersal of Girtab, and whispers, "Shimmach," before rising into the air on the back of an enormous swallow made of the same benighted skystuff, Kaido taking on form with elements of giant bat, roc, and wyvern following his ascent. content:
The Scion of the Ny√≠rb√°tor March would spot the appearance of the eldritch abomination with cold calculating eyes. 

"Guildmaster, I'll leave it to you!" She shouted before using the mass of hot air she had been gathering to envelop her and raise her upwards towards the air battle with the dreadnoughts.

"Ahh!" cried out Anna as she saw the three hunters attack her, head on. "SOMEONE HELP ME!" she cried out as loudly as she could manage as she raised her hand up, sending out a bolt of flame from it towards one of the hellwasp riders as she turned around, beating as rapid a retreat as she could manage.

Seizan, distracted by the feeding frenzy she'd entered, directed a portion of the oceanic current of magical power she was absorbing from her prey to shake-off the curse, an itching annoyance to her sin-addled mind, but otherwise pays no heed to the oncoming attack.

Adam, however, notices through many eyes an attack being prepared against his love, and cannot abide it. He directs Shimmach towards the offending dreadnought, abandoning his task of being a distracting fly to the First and Foremost for now, and reclaims the Energy-Concentrating Blow which Kaido has been maintaining for the last several exchanges, raising up his Phoenix Talon and striking at the harpoon-gun to disable it, before beginning to slaughter the devils manning the ship's other guns.

content: The monstrosity was struck in an eye with the flame, and buzzed wrathfully as its rider lost control and ended up sailing into a wall and falling off. The other two attacked, shooting a crossbow bolt each.

referenced_message.content: "Ahh!" cried out Anna as she saw the three hunters attack her, head on. "SOMEONE HELP ME!" she cried out as loudly as she could manage as she raised her hand up, sending out a bolt of flame from it towards one of the hellwasp riders as she turned around, beating as rapid a retreat as she could manage.

content: Adam sailed into the dreadnought and noticed its obdurate armor was heavy and stiff enough to resist even him, even though Seizan managed to slip the leash. The harpoon gun collapsed into pieces as the devils were exterminated.

content:
With bestial instincts she'd instantly jump again, crushing rooftop tiles below her feet. Above the ambushers, she'd spread her body wide instead of protecting herself to take as much of the crossbow bolts and magic for the princess riding on her back. 

Out of her left palm, a jet stream of crimson claret would erupt with the intensity of a water hose towards the Sorcerer. All with the intent to grab onto him and mid air pull herself out of this precarious situation like a fucked up spiderman.

"Lucky shot." mused Anna to herself as she watched the rider splatter against a wall. A thought that got disrupted a second later as one bolt wizzed by her head and a second struck her in the chest causing her to scream in pain. Her hand went to the bolt, trying to pull it out, as healing energy flowed through her hand to try and close the wound in its wake. Immediately she took off running again.

"HELP!" she screamed out as she tried to duck behind any cover she could find to finish healing, catch her breath, then focus on conjuring up a bolt of flame. "If I get out of this, I'm going to need to pick up some more magical prowess."

Adam would continue flitting about the sky, keeping careful watch of any forces that look to be turning towards Seizan to stop them before any real attack can be launched at her. If he gets the chance, he'll still send a potshot over towards the First and Foremost, but his focus will be on defending his love as she continues to gorge on the enemy's forces.

referenced_message.content: Adam sailed into the dreadnought and noticed its obdurate armor was heavy and stiff enough to resist even him, even though Seizan managed to slip the leash. The harpoon gun collapsed into pieces as the devils were exterminated.

content: Although most of the bolts didn't do much, the crimson lightning stung with cursed energy, a debilitating agony that wracked the nerves like waterfalls of torment. The sorcerer was caught immediately by the claret webbing anyway, as it wrapped around his chest.

Isabella sprinted for the demon, the air becoming thinner around her and offering less resistance, allowing her to be just fast enough to narrowly dodge the ball aimed at her. As she sprinted through, she struck the still-extended chain downwards, leveraging the weight and speed of the ball to make it swivel back onto its owner. Failing that, she'd strike with her own mace at much the same fury the demon had elected to deploy on her.

referenced_message.content: "If you insist," said a demon in a suit of regalia with an amused chuckle, armor more gold and silver than sovereign battle-metal. It stepped out from the ranks of its fellows and unchained a flail with a wicked barb on each side, swinging it with casual skill as it approached. Once it was within three reaches of the arm, the devil swung the flail and the chain snapped out, becoming longer: a ball as heavy as a car directed at Isabella's stomach with deadly, organ-crushing speed.

content:
*How did this even happen?* In midst the festivities, 'Ash' had been preoccupied tending to his own stall, showcasing plethora of curious magitech-powered toys to the children. And, not wishing for any sort of mishaps to occur around kids, 'Ash' had opted out of carrying his trusted magitech rifles. And so when Hell abruptly invaded Albion, 'Ash' was left cursing his lack of foresight as he could only duck under his stall.

In his own defence, who in the world could anticipate an invasion from Hell?!

"Think, Albrecht, *think*," he mutters to himself as he begins to rummage through a box of spare parts, looking for *anything* he could use for a weapon. "You escaped that whore Morgan, you can figure something out here..." After a brief moment of tinkering, 'Ash' had acquired himself a handful of what were essentially magitech powered pipe bombs. "Screw it." Staring at his sloppy handiwork, 'Ash' takes a breath of courage before popping out from beneath his stall and joining the fray. 

Immediately, he is alerted to a woman's cry for help. Turning to the source, he watches as Anna is attacked by two hellish monstrosities wielding crossbows. Turning to the enemy, 'Ash' casts magic missile. The spell comes out almost instantaneously, flying at one of the riders with dead accuracy. Without even waiting for the first to connect, 'Ash' aims toward the second one and throws a second magic missile at it. "Oi, look this way, you deformed circus freaks!" He taunts.

Covered in wounds and a deep electric burnt that sent agonizing pulses of her pain all through her body. Her deepest innate desired that she either fight or flee from this.

As her wounds snapped shut, her body shifted into an unnatural bestial way.

She'd pull on the crimson cord she had onto the mage and drag herself out of the air towards him, using her other hand she'd attempt to get stab her rapidly growing claw like nails through his skull. 

**"INSENSATE FIENDS. I AM THE ARCHITECT OF YOUR MISERY AND THE BLUEPRINTS OF YOUR SUFFERING WILL BE __MASTERPIECES__." ** Lupe howled.
He died almost immediately on impact. The others fired one more salvo.

Floating in the sky with her azure cape fluttering in a heroically majestic way, as if on purpose, the Marchioness to be manipulating the winds would stare down the fleet of flying enemy ships with annoyance. 

Looking up at the Cumulonimbus above her she would nod satisfied. 

With the mass of hot air gathered around her, she would extend her magic upward and precisely combine the cold air currents with it in a twister. Forming a veritable natural disaster in the forming of a cyclone with her at the middle, right next to Hell's ships.
The demon casually shortened the chain until it snapped into the form of a mace. It avoided Isabella's strike deftly, weaving between blows, and then countering with its own.

referenced_message.content: Isabella sprinted for the demon, the air becoming thinner around her and offering less resistance, allowing her to be just fast enough to narrowly dodge the ball aimed at her. As she sprinted through, she struck the still-extended chain downwards, leveraging the weight and speed of the ball to make it swivel back onto its owner. Failing that, she'd strike with her own mace at much the same fury the demon had elected to deploy on her.

content:
With her hand stuck deeply in the top of the now concaved skull of the mage, she'd open her palm and force a stream of her blood into it's cadaver before launching the body at the rest of the assailants. 

It erupted in a bloody, gory explosion from the pressure of her blood all with the intended purpose of harming the rest of his allies with visceral shrapnel of bones, teeth propelled by the pressure of her blood.
Alecto watched as her chosen was covered in viscera, and she couldn't help but smile. What a lovely pet.
One day, she'd make an excellent hound.
Both of the demons are struck by Ash's attacks, staggered and off-balance: after a second to recover, both of them fire upon him in retribution.

content: After returning her attack with extreme firepower and an assault of hell-wasps, the ships began to retreat once more through the gates.
