content: *Gnaddagnome grumbles under his breath at the lack of reaction his Arbalest's strikes prompted from the Demon, and cranked his weapon up for another volly. Leaping from his place on the roof, he flips and cartwheels his way to a different roof and fires again (two shots, electrically charged), this time at the lesser demons on the street below.*

"Battlefield etiquette-" Isabelle struck the demon with her mace across the shoulder, cracking his pauldron, while narrowly dodging a hit that would've smashed her head off her neck. "-Usually dictates you don't wear such gaudy armor, to not attract attention. But it's too late, you attracted _mine_!" 

At that, she exerted herself and flared her Spirit minimally. All of the grass around her caught on fire from the sheer concentration of magical power, and all of her muscles tensed. Power flowed down her limbs, imbuing in her next strike the might of the Heavens Above. She sprinted forward, faster than she'd yet moved in this fight, and went for a killing strike.

referenced_message.content: The demon casually shortened the chain until it snapped into the form of a mace. It avoided Isabella's strike deftly, weaving between blows, and then countering with its own.

content: Reacting with swiftness, the devil reached into its belt compartment and flipped a violet coin - a coin that flashed away into a nebulous astral gleam and took the demon with it, both disappearing.

referenced_message.content:
"Battlefield etiquette-" Isabelle struck the demon with her mace across the shoulder, cracking his pauldron, while narrowly dodging a hit that would've smashed her head off her neck. "-Usually dictates you don't wear such gaudy armor, to not attract attention. But it's too late, you attracted _mine_!" 

At that, she exerted herself and flared her Spirit minimally. All of the grass around her caught on fire from the sheer concentration of magical power, and all of her muscles tensed. Power flowed down her limbs, imbuing in her next strike the might of the Heavens Above. She sprinted forward, faster than she'd yet moved in this fight, and went for a killing strike.

content: "Pussy!" Isabelle called out right before her mace struck the ground. It caused a nearby stone wall to topple. "Ah, shit, Hastur'll kill me."

Across Williamstown, a call for retreat sounded amongst Hell's armies. Its partizans and soldiers began to flee through portals of similar make as the ones they entered through.

Above, in the heavens, the First and Foremost chuckled as the Guildmaster attempted to lock him within a cage of made of the very idea of sealing and locks. A simple flexing of musculature created an outermost gradient of disruptive, magical air, dispelling even the carefully woven and supernal Dreamcraft of Hastur's make. The First threw a sword like a boomerang, severing Hastur in half, then fled through a portal.

As the Guildmaster regenerated on a rooftop, he called through every seal, "I'm confirming a retreat of the enemy's forces."

After being batted away, the triumphant, albeit damaged chair would watch as the demon would be pelted with a beam of light. Her mission accomplished, the blue soul would slip out of the luminescent wooden craft as she'd watch the ongoings of the battle, "supernatural" seeming quite natural as one by one, the demons would retreat, and sure enough, she'd get a little notification affirming such a thought from her seal, though a different voice would catch her attention.

"Language-" Julie would pitch to the annoyed woman, handily slipping inside the stone brick as she'd float wobbly back up to where it was, wedge it back in, then pop right back out with a strangely smug aura for a body-less entity.

"I don't know who you are, but thank you for helping me out." said Anna with a smile as she noted Ash's arrival. "Name's Anna. We gotta keep ready until these jerksfaces are gone!"

@losthaven
**"ALL GOOD UP THERE?"** A very metallic and boisterous voice calls up from one of the bunkers near the stages

Hearing the Guildmaster's statement, and knowing that Seizan was in no state to listen, Adam sets to the task of calming her down from her feeding frenzy, directing her away from the Williamstown to minimize the property damage and friendly casualties she might cause before she regains control of herself.
The Aftermath

After an hour, the clean-up efforts started: directed by geoticists and earth mages, reconstructing buildings and streets. Corpses were hauled to a collection point for identification, and sick, wounded and cursed tended to in a triage area next to the square.
*Dame Calluna stands off in a corner, watching the reconstruction  and the gathering of the dead as she considers the likely ramifications of the attack.*
*Below the streets, Gnomio Gnaddagnome tends to the pipes and water ways of the city, some of which had been burst sabotaged or otherwise damaged in the attack.*
Alecto cuddled a little closer to Lupe, looking on apathetically at the ruin.

Adam did manage to drive Seizan away from the city and into the surrounding wilderness, where she tore up some of the terrain, ate a considerable amount of the local wildlife. After she returned to her humanoid form, recovered from the exertion and digested her enormous meal, the two of them came back into town. Neither is *especially* well-suited to general rebuilding tasks, so instead both sought out the Guildmaster to see if he could give them any other tasks.

For the next while Chrome spends his time initially guiding the children saved to their parents (And acting as a shoulder to cry on for those who no longer have any before guiding them to anybody he knows who might have been looking into adoptions) before once they're all with somebody helping out as much as he can with reconstruction, even if it means something as simple as acting as a pillar for a building for a few minutes while a proper mage builds real supports

The totally normal human witch was caked in a rufescent shade from top to bottom. The brim of her hat flopped down soaked with blood.

She was panting like crazy, long tongue out to let more air in, hazy look in her eyes. Heat in the form of steam was radiating off of her, her totally human regeneration factor still excited after that attack.

It was unfortunate humans couldn't like, sweat to regulate their heat or something.

Anna had made herself busy in the meanwhile. The red-head had no immense power, but she had one thing essential to cleaning up aftermath. Healing magic. She almost immediately made her way over to the triage area and started to tend to civilians. Part of her wanted to charge them coin, a huge part, but a much more... overwhelming sensation... told her that doing so would do nothing but result in bad blood.

"My name is Anna. Let me heal you. If you wanna show your gratitude... just... Anything will do." she rehersed to herself as she went towards the wounded to start helping out, wondering if the other people she had met beforehand and that guy who had come to her rescue had gotten out okay.

"I have good news my friends, I have meditated long behind closed doors and found new insi-" A gnomish samurai stops as he looks out the ruined city. The cries of the wounded echoing in the air still as pillars of smoke climb to the sky.

"Oh my."

And then in a flash of light Gnack is gone off to try and rescue those he can.

A figure watched from the shadows.
Not because she was lurking in them, but rather they frequently decided she seemed like a good spot to congregate.

A chalk-pale woman who seemed like a corpse someone had forgot to bury tilted her head at the scene of carnage and recovery. She clenched her sinister staff tight, which was *not* a euphemism even if one could be forgiven for thinking otherwise with the elated breath that escaped out her lips.

‚ÄúTh-They did it‚Ä¶‚Äù she mumbled dreamily. ‚ÄúO-O-Of course they did, what am I saying? Hee-hee‚Ä¶‚Äù

Her stuttering, dull voice made what might have been a giggle come out somewhere between awkward and unsettling.

Noticing the... quite frankly ominously posed figure in the shade while he's delivering a young girl back to her father Chrome wanders over with a smile, shimmering into a shinier metal as he closes.

"Hello! Are you with the guild helping clean up after this disaster?"

He's honestly half sure she's a leftover from the demonic invasion, but he's willing to have hope here!

content:
‚ÄúH-Huh?‚Äù

The woman turned to look at him, and could not have seemed more menacing if she tried. Her outfit wouldn‚Äôt look too out of place in most adventurers, but it was still well worn and stained in burns and the marks of blood. The‚Ä¶ *cloak* she wore didn‚Äôt help matters, and she would have looked like a certain bloodsucking race if not for the lack of fangs.

‚ÄúO-Oh, I- um. Sorry. I just got here, I‚Äôm not with the G-Guild. I only saw the tail end of the invasion.‚Äù

For some reason, she twisted her head and was speaking directly to the wall rather than turning to address him.

"Oh so you weren't here for the beginning? That's good to hear you weren't in the worst of it then!"

Dear God, its frankly blinding how bright his smile is after being 'Told' that she wasn't hurt in the attack.

"And hey, you just getting here is great! You're here at the perfect time to help everybody rebuild, get better and fix their lives back up!"

Hope she isn't physically attached to that shadow because this metallic ball of Heroic Purpose is one thousand percent wrapping an arm around her shoulder to walk her out of it to go and help more people out!

There is a soft sound that may have been the dying rasp of a banshee but more than likely was some kind of squeak at the contact.

Internally, Tamah‚Äôs mind turned to static. This man oozed the spirit of heroism so blatantly she worried color might return to her pallid cheeks.

She gave a silent, shaky thumbs up and a nod with a sound that might have been a grunt of affirmation or might have been a terrified horse screaming in the night.

A horse screaming in the night is good enough for being good enough! So she's getting guided over to the (Smaller than it was earlier in the day) group of kids he's been mother-ducking around Fort Grey to find their parents.

"Heya little ones! I know today hasn't been great, but my friend here is going to help you out finding your way home, isn't that nice of her?"

He's, really REALLY trying to hype her up, despite her visuals being I'm some ways more unnerving than the recent Infernal invasion, and these being a small squad of likely traumatised youngsters-

‚ÄúH-H-Hey!‚Äù

She gives a smile with too much teeth and peers at them through wide raccoon eyes. A younger child looks to be on the verge of tears, while a tween boy looks like he‚Äôs realizing something about himself.

‚ÄúW-Where do you children live? Want me to hunt down your p-parents?‚Äù

Leaning down a little closer he whispers out of the corner of his mouth.

"Find your parents, probably not hunt down... Well unless they're abusive obviously but I'll trust your judgement on that end."

Clearing his throat and perking up again he gently picks her up before he holds her out towards the children and sets her on her feet again.

"So! My newest friend here will take half of you all and help you find your way home again, good? Great! I know it's been a bad day but I just **Know** it can get better for you all!"

With hands on his hips and a light that honestly shouldn't be coming from anywhere but the sky reflecting off his silvered skin Chrome starts to guide off his smaller section of the children away, calling over his shoulder to Tamah.

"Good luck! It's great to meet another new Hero, especially in times like this!"

Tamah waves off the hero brightly.

‚ÄúT-Thanks!‚Äù

Friend. Another hero.

The moment Chrome turns. Tamah rushes to a waste bin and vomits.

Wiping the- black liquid? - from her mouth, Tamah turns as if nothing happen.

‚ÄúS-Sorry. Um. I-I‚Äôm allergic to- demonic residue.‚Äù

Although unsettled, the children do reluctantly point her in the dire ruin of their homes and she starts to lead them back with utmost seriousness, like this is the most important mission she has ever had.
Visuden's request

Torrents of demonic spheres collapsed in on themselves sinking in the vacant air. Above the clouds of white and water a whale of steel flew, and from the windows Circely watched hell retreat. 

‚ÄúMy lady, We will be landing soon.‚Äù

Circley looked to the assistant and gave affirmation as the airship descended toward Fort Grey. The craft made landing within a designated space for flying aircraft and after confirmation of safely protocols she exited the machine.

From the ship, an automobile was unloaded for Circely‚Äôs personal use, and a butler took the wheel, from there she would be taken to the entrance of Fort Grey. She had made an announcement of her intent for assistance at the behest of Visuden beforehand and after existing her vehicle, was led to one of the guild‚Äôs receptionists.

‚ÄúMiss Selhorn, I understand you made this request beforehand, but we were recently assaulted by malicious and powerful individuals. I can‚Äôt promise many people will be likely to assist you. The majority of the guild is focused on recuperation.‚Äù The receptionist informed her.

Circley thought for a moment, before responding. ‚ÄúI understand. We are particularly in need as well it seems. Beneath the capital there is a rebellion forming in the sewers and our attempts to flush them out have been in vain. Regardless, whoever you have that is willing I would be happy to have.‚Äù

The receptionist gave her an odd look before tapping the guild seal to open a general communication line.

‚ÄúIlya, the request you expressed interest in is here. And for that matter if there is anyone else that wants to join, sounds like this one is open for the taking.‚Äù
@alteras | Ilya Reyes

The guild seal echoed back an affirmation in an easy tone, much in counter to the frenetic nature the fort had been in the past few hours. After a few minutes, a woman with a large pointy hat and a large compendium by her side emerged from one of the hallways into the main lobby. Walking towards the attending receptionist, she passed her a stack of paper. "Pathfinder Ilya Reyes, submitting my report on the recent battle," the woman summarily stated.

Ilya readjusted her glasses as she completed the handoff. An hour ago she was standing on one of the spires of the fort, acting as a forward observer. With her skills in long range detection and magic vision, she had been directing Guild forces throughout Williamstown to areas most needed. At the end of the battle, she was preparing to join the cleanup and rescue operations, but when she spotted the Visuden airship at the edge of her detection field, she frantically moved to write up her report on the battle instead. *'Not even Hell's invasion can stop a noble's demands,'* Ilya thought to herself as she turned to face the lady.

A brief surprise fluttered across Ilya's face before relaxing into a friendly smile. "Pathfinder Ilya Reyes, at your service," Ilya greeted as she bowed. She was internally sighing in relief at her decision to make herself more presentable with the usage of several life magic spells.

"It is a pleasure to see you again Lady Selhorn. I wish it was at a better situation, but the Guild welcomes you nonetheless. Please, follow me." Ilya motioned her toward one of the private lounges for receiving foreign dignitaries. "Please direct anyone who wishes to join to the Pheles Lounge," she instructed the receptionist before leaving herself.

Floating above the ruined city would be a bright Halcyon radiance, enveloping a woman in noble blue robes that fluttered majestically in the air around her. Out from her, an aura of cosy and reassuring warmth would envelop the people she floated over like a goddess of kindness. 

Rubble in droves would be seen all around them melt down into slag before being moulded by precise motes of cold temperature into perfect bricks and other building materials for reconstruction.

All while the Scion of the Ny√≠rb√°tor smiled "kindly" down onto the people below.

The city was on the verge of ruins. Screams rang out through the air, weeping, wailing, the sounds of dying. The breeze was thick with the scent of ashes and a hint of roasting. The Guildmaster stepped down him his plinth and began conferring with the town's remaining officials, waving one eldritch hand to send out impromptu missions and messages to the members of the guild in iridescent soap bubbles.

**REBUILD THE RUINS** - *Do what you can to help the town recover. There's people to save, bodies to move, fires to put out and looters to quell. Self-directed work, but work that I have full faith you might accomplish.*

**MESSAGE TO ALBION** - *A Hellish invasion on Albionese soil is something the King must be informed of in person. Go out to speak with him and his councilors, and see what might be done to lend the peoples of Williamstown some aid.*

**THE REGIMENT** - *A regiment of soldiers has arrives to offer immediate assistance. Coordinate with them effectively to see where they might be most useful.*

**DEATH FIRST TO VULTURES** - *Given the state of their home, anti-social elements are likely to believe the Guild is in disarray. Go out to the nearby towns, villages and other settlements and expunge any banditry and the like you find fomenting there.*

After receiving the dreamcrafted messages, Adam and Seizan briefly discuss whether to join with the royal message job or the anti-banditry job. Meeting with the King might position them well to improve their local standing, and Seizan isn't unfamiliar with courtly etiquette, but the pair's abilities are certainly still better suited to hunting bandits than plying courtesans, and Adam's **Orchard of Eyes** has already informed him of several situations that may soon evolve into banditry.

In the end, they decide that they can contribute more to hunting bandits, and set off from Williamstown to start helping maintain law and order in the wake of the invasion.

Dame Calluna walks over to a pile of rubble and, with a wave of her hand, brings up floating before her. The stone on her cane flairs softly, and the rubble melts and molds itself into a moddle of the city, as is.

Standing before the model, she whispers a few words of power and slowly, the miniature rubble rises into the air and back into place, it's larger counter parts in the city doing the same. Calluna watches the reconstruction carefully until the last bit of rubble, her miniature city, melts away and flies back into place in the nearby wall. 

"Hm. Age has not yet robbed me of *all* my uses just yet, it seems."

Isabella moved towards Calluna, seeing her do this magic work. She approached the model of the city and studied it closely, trying not to disturb the lady's work as she observed with glee the display of magical prowess that... she was yet to be able to employ. Mace and armor was a quick way to keep her safe and effective, but she had a deep appreciation for the magical arts and she kinda wanted to cultivate them.

"Ma'am, can I do anything to help?"

_ _
As this was happening, an entire regiment of Albionian soldiers, led by ten fancily armored men on horseback, came into the town, with a supply wagon behind them full of supplies, humanitarian aid, as well as workers to help rebuild.

Dame Calluna leans slightly more on her cane then before the spell, and turns to face Isabella. 

"Gather the wounded and extinguish the fires, I have expended myself on structural repairs and lack the energy to assist  in healing."

The dame pauses for a moment an considers Isabella for a moment. "Also, fetch me a chair. My bones ache and my eyes darken. I require a moment of rest to gather my strength."
Isabella nodded dutifully, and moved a nearby piece of large rubble behind the lady to provide her with seating. Immediately after that, she ran to gather the wounded as instructed.

Following Ilya, both passed many rooms of the expansive hallways contained in Fort Grey. Members of the Guild swiftly used magic of all kinds to rebuild their lost structures. Stone constructs lifted into the air, metal was sealed shut and those lives lost were taken away to their burial. 

Along the way Circley returned the gestures of friendship with idle chatter and pulled back on some formalities.

‚ÄúIt is good to see you again friend, it feels like ages ago since we last talked. Most likely because I haven‚Äôt been around Albion much. Since then, I have primarily been in Espania and Laurellia. I have spent almost half a year in those combined. But I recently returned to Visuden and that‚Äôs when this request got handed over to me.‚Äù

As they entered one of the lounge areas Circley took the cue and sat down. She looked back to her assistant, and he pulled out a booklet full of different papers. 
He briefly shuffled a moment before pulling out a rather large, folded paper and handed it to her. Circley laid the paper out across a table which centered the room.

‚ÄúIn relation to this request. As you already know, Visudens capital Lithos has a complicated past with its environment. During the early months of the year the rain can become extremely deadly in quantity, as such large guidance tunnels were created underneath the city, and now are used to help create power as well.

During the current time of year however, the rain is minimal, and the tunnels largely go used. It had never been a problem before, but now it seems a group of what we believe are Eldorians, have made a hideout down there. Due to the complicated nature of the place, it‚Äôs difficult to weed them out, so that is where you come in.

Phoe is revealing a new invention in a couple days at a yearly festival, so they should be cleared out by then. This map will show you the routes as well as the entrances, of which there are four.‚Äù

Circley pulled back giving Ilya time to think over the information, while she leaned against the fabric of the of the chair.

‚ÄúAll in all, their force isn‚Äôt particularly large, and Visuden will be assisting in the cleanup as well. Your main job will be finding out what they are doing, and destroying the leadership."

She paused again.

"Any questions?‚Äù

Ilya set down a cup of tea before Circley as she received the paper from the assistant. Reading through and listening to her explanation, Ilya's face flattened to a thoughtful appearance. Placing the paper back down onto the table, she looked back at Circley's relaxed figure.

"A few," she responded back, before pulling out a small notepad to write upon. "But first, I want to clarify something. I understand the Visuden empire maintains a sizeable and capable force. And with this matter concerning... hostile elements and it occurring beneath the street of Lithos, surely the better approach would be for the empire to solely use its own military, even at a higher cost and duration."

Ilya reached for her guild seal and very clearly tucked it into the back of her magical pouch. Silencing the device was a pointless gesture within the walls of Fort Grey, but it was enough to convey the seriousness in her next words. "If I may be so bold, the risk involved with letting the Guild partake is... heavy, no? With the exception of Albion and some minor players, most nations keep us at arms length when it comes to political matters. While we do holdfast to our oath of duty to all, I must admit there are many who remain suspicious of our actions. What exactly is in Lithos that the military can't handle?"

Her hand raised in a vertical formation to signal the butler to leave the room. He briefly bowed and made his way out of the room. Circley paused for a moment thinking over her respond, deciding what she wanted to tell Ilya. 

Though she largely disliked her sister‚Äôs actions, right now Circley represented Visuden‚Äôs request for aid.
‚ÄúWell, if we are in the spirit of being bold. My guess for what‚Äôs below Lithos‚Ä¶is a trap.‚Äù

Circley pointed to the four entrances of the underground tunnel system, the *only* four entrances.

‚ÄúThese are the singular ways in or out of the system. If it truly is Eldorian members below, they probably intend for us to march an army underneath our own city to clear them out.
But what would happen if right after that army walked in, the exits collapse and trapped a section of the Visuden military underneath their city?‚Äù

She raised her hand into the air pointing toward the floor.

‚ÄúAnd suddenly with a large portion of Visuden effort being spent attempting to save their citizen from the labyrinth below the city, Eldor walks on to our doorstep? 

You see this isn‚Äôt simply a group of fanatical Eldorian believers, played incorrectly this may be a declaration of war‚Ä¶‚Äù

She didn‚Äôt say it, but given the nature of Visudens actions, the cultivation of houses that run it also came to this conclusion. It was also the reason they were clearing this with a small elite force instead of a larger one.

‚ÄúWith the Guild involved, Visuden is backed by a morally neutral group and is given more elite members to ensure success. Additionally, Eldor is less likely to pull any major stunts since the death of any guild member would result in a powerful enemy.

If the guilds quest is to keep peace, this would be the best way to see the dawn.‚Äù

Circley gave time for Ilya to respond, afterward she would call back for the butler to return and then suggest they make their way toward the airship, and other questions could be answered along the way. If need be, any other adventures could join them along the way.

Ilya nodded slowly at Circley's words. Perhaps silencing her guild seal wasn't just a diplomatic gesture as she thought it was. Rather, she was shivering in cold relief that she did. If the more temperamental members of the Guild had heard those words, they'd probably fly into a rage. After all, Visuden's real request was, to put it positively, to be a deterrent. Put negatively, *become bait.*

Still, Circley's final words were correct. The Guild's and this *quest's* mission are ultimately the same: *to keep the peace.* In this situation where the Guild and the whole of Albion faced a sudden invasion from demons with an unknown objective, Melicau couldn't afford to split itself on a possible internal war. The Guild of Heroes *must* accept this quest.

Standing up slowly, Ilya looked at the Visuden representative. Raising her arm in the Pathfinder salute, and with as much confidence she could muster, said "On behalf of the Guild of Heroes, Pathfinder Ilya Reyes hereby accepts this quest. Of course I have some further questions, but its best to wait for a party to form before I continue."

Leading the representatives out of the lounge and back towards their airship, Ilya stopped by the receptionist once more. Handing over a freshly written document she penned on the walk, she smiled at her. "Our client is submitting this request on behalf of the Visuden Empire. Please process it. We'll await for quest takers at the aerodrome." Ilya then followed Circley to the airship.

---

As Ilya walked away, the receptionist calmly picked up the paper and started manipulating the arcane console by her side. Soon a new quest appeared on the magical boards surrounding the lobby.

**In the Shadows of Lithos** ‚Äî Days before a festival in Lithos, capital of the Visuden Empire, signs of hostile elements arise. Visuden has requested the Guild's aid to keep the peace. Investigate the capital and protect the smiles of the innocent. Accepting Guild members of any rank. Expect anti-personnel combat. To accept, go to the Visuden Airship.

Confidential details (TLDR): ||Below the streets of Lithos are an underground network of tunnels for flood and sewage management. Hostile enemies of Visuden have been spotted congregating in the labyrinthine subterrain. It is unknown who or what their purpose is, but Visuden fears them to be the long time enemy Eldor. Investigate their identity and plans and prevent any harm to the city.||

To say that the trip back to Albion was a 'smooth' one would be much like claiming that fire was cold - a blatant fucking lie.

The shelves shook and items rattled while in the control room, the elder lich wrestled fiercely against the tesseract as he attempted to gain control over the situation. "Why in fuck do you not just have a planar bridge?!" Cried Xylzrilyn as they were thrown left and right around the walls.

"Hmm~? Don't you know that it only works on inorganic matter? Didn't you see what happened to Vorinclex when he used it?" Replies Alexiel, holding onto her lance that she had lodged deep into a wall. Though the tone of her voice seemed indifferent, the veins practically popping out of her hands and arms as she held on for dear life told a different story. 

"Do **NOT** question the Lord, you ungrateful, floating ball of worthlessness! He undoubtedly would have accounted for this in his plans!" Bellows Kodbramaal, whose strength was so titanic that he had stabilised himself simply by digging into the floorboards with his toes. 

"Nobody's plan could foresee a Sylex being detonated in the middle of the Blind Eternities," Emily who was comfortably fastened to Kodbromaal, interjects.

"**ALL OF YOU, SHUT THE FUCK UP!**" Faust, who had finally had enough of their useless comments hollers at the top of his lungs, like he was a dad yelling at four, petulant children bickering in his car. Despite his struggles, the heart of the Raven's Arcana's interdimensional travel system, the tesseract, gives out and shatters into a million little fragments. The interplanar engine lets out a scream that could only be described as 'a mentally impaired banshee in heat' as red lights and alarms go off all around the control room. "FUCKING HELL, BRACE FOR IMPACT!" Faust yells as he loses all control of the R.A. There wasn't enough time to prevent a crash landing. He could only hope to soften the impact.

‚Äî--

In an empty alley, though not spared from Hell's vicious onslaught, the Raven's Arcana flashes into existence, releasing a residual shockwave of such magnitude that the tremors in the earth could be felt all across Williamstown and Fort Grey. Thanks to the lich's magic, the collateral damage had been mitigated to only a small area around the initial point of impact.

The rickety shop's doors swing open, letting out an enormous huff of smoke and singed mana from overloaded mana engines. Faust Windfallow, owner of the Raven's Arcana stumbles out, robes aflame and coughing and hacking despite a clear lack of lungs. The rest of his clown troupe trail out, the 'paladin' and beholderbutlerdeathtyrantmaidthing no better for wear, while Kodbromaal and Emily seemed just fine. 

"FUCK, so much for watching the demons!" Curses Faust, stepping all over his own robes to put out the fire. 

"The area appears to have been ravaged before we even arrived, but there are no demonic forces to be seen," observes Emily.

"Ara? It seems that Hell had already called for a full retreat~" said Alexiel, holding Faust's personal guild seal and scrolling through the backlog of transmissions they had missed whilst Faust was struggling with crash landing his shop.

"FUCK," curses Faust, even louder than before. In frustration, he snatches the Guild Seal off Alexiel's hands and pegs it at the sky with such power that it flies into the burning horizon, letting off one last gleam before vanishing into the distance. "FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU-"

"... I'm heading to the Guild‚Ä¶ They probably need hands, and I'd like to bathe." Mumbles Emily as she leaves the schizophrenic old lich to have his tantrum.

"**Same**," agrees two of the three remaining members of the Arcana.

A pleasant breeze swept by as Carter came to a stop on yellowed grass. Her heavy cape fluttered heroically, bright red billowing as muted black fanned out and spread, and she reached up to keep her hat still as she craned her neck to see the vast white behemoth that was Visuden's airship. She had no love for ships, couldn't tell what beauty there was to appreciate, but even she who often went out of her way to avoid these metal transport death traps felt at ease as she marveled its spotless appearance. Surely, a fine crew must be serving her; there had been enough explosions and ruin today, the last thing she wanted was to have their ride go up in flames.

A whistling cry came from above, and Carter smoothly extended her arm out to allow her companion to come to rest on the plated leather armguards. Shoot, hopefully their very important and noble client wouldn't have problems with her companion on board ... but spotting a familiar looking pointy-hat standing before the airship put her at ease. Ilya, that thorough woman, must have already prepared all the necessary arrangements as soon as their lovely receptionist sent word and arcane notice of Carter's decision to join the party. 

Dusting herself off and shifting Grey over onto her shoulder, Carter squared herself and made haste to properly present herself. 

An arm bent behind her back, and a fist right at her chest, Carter crashed into a salute with a firm smile. "Carter Solheim, Hero of the Guild, ready and waiting," her eyes shifted to each person, before letting herself relax, falling into line just a ways away from Ilya, dipping her head just so, and murmuring quietly her way, "Word going around, clean-up is progressing well ... many of our own were just grabbing a hearty meal to eat when I left the Guild," and then a bit of a flustered expression, "surely you already have a better idea than I regarding the rebuilding efforts, just can't help but to share some good news after the shitstorm earlier."

The crew of the Eostre airship shuffled in anticipation of the return of their noblewoman. Arrangements for cleaning, preparing midflight food, checking the engines and fueling had been made beforehand, but the crew would always feel like they were rushed, just behind where they would like to be. Most of the preparation were complete however, and as the silver automobile entered from the edge of their view, they hastily prepared for its load into the cargo bay.

Circley and Ilya stepped out, after the assistance of the butlers opening the door for them. Circley gave a small gesture of thanks, and the crew loaded her vehicle into the back of the airship. The captain informed Circley of the readied machine.

"Excellent. Helmsmen, give everyone time to enter the ship and in thirty minutes take us up." 

The captain bowed and signaled the others, and each member of the Eostre once again rushing into an orchestra of efficiency, which seldom didn‚Äôt bring a smile to Circley. As Circley and Ilya idled in preparation to enter the airship they came across the already waiting Carter, a member who no doubt was acquainted with Ilya already.

"It is good to hear of the guilds recovery. I am Circley Selhorn, and if you are a friend of Ilya, then too consider yourself my friend as well. At the representation of the Selhorn family, and all of Visuden, thank you for accepting this task." Circley gave a modest bow of appreciation. 

"We should enter the craft. We can speak more on this there." Circley said making her way into the ships side entrance.

---

After everyone had been boarded onto the ship the captain would single each member for preparation. Sounding off one at a time the crew would give response of confirmation. Fire lifted from the exhaust ports and the supporting steel contraption ached as the pressure built from above. The buildup of heat in the upper section of the airship and countered the force of gravity and with the power created the industrial mammoth took to the skies.

Bundles of white water passed through the ship, and all could see the minuscule cities below, so small compared to the view on the ground. Something Circley could marvel at for hours on end. Within the contraption the service of food were provided to those onboard. Circley made her way to Ilya and Carter for mild chatter, and to clear any loose questions that lingered.

"I hope this is all to your satisfaction. Ilya I recall you had at least a bit more to speak about. Any specifics I could answer regarding that? Feel free to ask away as well Carter."

Ilya was enjoying the luxury provided by the airship. Entranced by the scenery beyond the window, she wondered if this is how those beings who can fly felt. Gazing upon beautiful rolling landscape and testaments of man's victory over nature, Ilya's sense of wander grew. Having travelled long and far, the places they passed over were familiar, yet the view was entirely new.

Ilya sighed in pleasure as she munched on the tea and snacks before her. Not only did she get to see the world from above, she could do so in comfort. Of course, it wasn't like Ilya *couldn't* use magic to fly herself, but such magic was locked behind one of the many ciphers within her compendium. And besides, she wouldn't be able to fly while talking with her companions over a decadent array of snacks.

While discussing random happenings with her Guild members and catching them up to speed on the current quest, she spotted Circley approaching from the corner of her eye. Nodding at Circley's resumption of the prior conversation, she swallowed down the cookie in her mouth.

"Ahem. Yes... Let's see... Right. I wanted to know how up to date is the map you shared with us? I understand that this being the capital, the underground should be treated with secrecy, but surely flood management and sewage tunnels can't be the only things below? Is it possible that our... strangers know about even deeper parts of Lithos?"

Carter wasn't surprised to see just how far Ilya had gone to bury every detail of the quest until it was just the right moment to share everything. Masterful, and professional; affording their client with the secrecy they warranted, and keeping the party of heroes safe from scrutiny should the worse happen. 

She would have plenty of time to rib the woman who actually tacked something as trite as "protect the smiles of the innocent" on an Empire's request for all to read and admire later. For now, Carter had the precious and short-lived luxury of keeping her shoulders loose, savoring the moist, buttery croissants piled generiously before them, and pondering what exactly friendship with Circley Selhorn, who joined the table, may entail. 

Washing away the last bite of a croissant with warm tea, Carter followed Ilya after a polite pause. 

**"If the interlopers are found, would you be interested in having us bring back bodies for you?"** She ventured quietly, unsure, truly, how Visuden may intend to treat their long-time adversaries, **"Another question comes to mind, assuming the suspected Eldorian Hideout is hidden deeper ... what typical traps should we anticipate on our way? The textbooks I read favor the might and tactics of Visuden and little else, unfortunately."** She smiled toothily.

At the last few moments before the airship took off, a blonde woman was escorted by two guild staff to board the said vessel, and even followed her into the very ship's interior, leaving only just before the vessel took to the skies.

Apparently, she had been in a rather heated discourse with some of the guild staff, including a receptionist, about the guild's response to the recent attack - specifically on its seeming inaction on hunting down the fiends responsible for the disturbance.

Long story short, she had been convinced that the guild was indeed taking the necessary actions, but were prioritizing on handling more urgent matters - such as recuperating from the damages. Clearly, it was not by her own choice that she had taken on this quest.

---

When the time for questions and concerns came, the two, more experienced members of the guild were quick to voice out. Bianca, on the other hand, opted to listen in, taking sips from the elvish tea she has been offered by the servants aboard the vessel.

Shuttering alterations lightly shook the craft as it passed over pockets of chaotic air. Circley briefly held the side of the chair tighter to regain some composer, gently pulling back several of the hairs that had fallen out of place. She took the brief pause as an excuse to think more over what she wanted to say.

‚ÄúThere is something I have neglected to tell you. Though it is not uncommon knowledge that Lithos was founded at the desire to mine out a substantial Orcobras cavern, many people forget the sheer size of the mine. It is not impossible that the enemy will have found lingering crystal veins. I would expect to go up against the primary elements which Orcobras can store, to what extend however, I know not. Expect Eldor to be clever and have the upper hand from the shadows. That's as much as I know as far as traps go. 

Regarding your question Carter. You will be joined with a Visuden warrior named Behemoth, it will be his job to identify the leader and deliver his remains back to us. He will also assist you in finding them as well.‚Äù

As Circley finished answering the question one of the attendants came to address the group. The ship would be landing soon on the outer edges of Lithos.
